newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Scala ECE has Q1 loss, merger near.
newsitem.headline: Scala ECE has Q1 loss, merger near.

text.p: Hungary-based business software company Scala ECE said on Friday it had a $266,000 Q1 loss based on revenues of $4.9 million, an 88 percent increase from $2.6 million in revenues in the same period last year.
It attributed the loss to the seasonality of its business and said it was less than a budgeted loss of $707,000.
In a joint press release, Scala ECE, which is listed on the Vienna stock exchange, and Scala International AB also said they had concluded a provisional merger agreement.
Under terms of the agreement, Scala ECE would have an initial 65 percent shareholding in the joint company while Scala International would have 35 percent, the statement said.
Andreas Kemi, chief executive of Scala ECE, would become chief executive officer and a member of the board of the new company, the statement said.
